column4: gparted did not give the option to resize from the main part, we had to drag with the outline of it in the top section

while i personally think resizing/combining partitions is insanity - IF swap is being used, it can stop gparted in it's tracks.  In terminal try "free" is swap listed?  if so, use "sudo swapoff -a" then confirm with "free" again.  after swap is disabled gparted might be able to do more for you.
